metadata.Title: CVE-2023-0464 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.Description: A security vulnerability has been identified in all supported versions ofOpenSSL related to the verification of X.509 certificate chains thatinclude policy constraints. Attackers may be able to exploit thisvulnerability by creating a malicious certificate chain that triggersexponential use of computational resources, leading to a denial-of-service(DoS) attack on affected systems. Policy processing is disabled by defaultbut can be enabled by passing the `-policy' argument to the command lineutilities or by calling the `X509_VERIFY_PARAM_set1_policies()' function.

criterions.comment: openssl package in fips-updates/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
edk2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
